intro: Pilosella huberi, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are hairy and lobed, while its flowers are small and yellow, often appearing in clusters. Pilosella huberi is adapted to cold climates and is often found at high altitudes.
